comment: Excellent professor all around. Dr. Christensen dissects much of the Calc 1 course content and explains it in layman's terms. You really *need* to be attentive for the lectures, though, as she expressively dislikes stupid/careless questions. She genuinely cares for each student's success, especially when it comes to preparing for 2202/2203.

Took her over the summer, she is strict but fair. She truly cares & will get u right for Calc 2. Lectures are super thorough too, & she gives helpful feedback if you ask questions. Office hours were a big help. Study guides are great practice, tests weren't bad, but the HW was a lot harder. She's very kind, just does NOT like careless questions.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I legitimately have no idea why this teacher is rated so highly. She yells at the class, if you ask a question that's stupid to her she shuns you publicly, she refuses to give you her annotated notes and has no answer key to study guides with her smugly saying "I'm not your answer key." Her grading is incredibly strict and doesn't care if you fail.

Dr. Christensen is great. If you have the opportunity to be in her class, don't hesitate to register.

She explains material thoroughly, but you must practice. She offers plenty of resources and there are study guides for each test. If there was anything negative to say, I would say she can sometimes over-complicate certain topics.

I was very nervous about taking this course. Im not going to lie, I was struggling for a while and under a lot of stress so my grades were beginning to drop as well as my attendance, but Professor Christensen had a private conversation with me about whats going on in my life and tried to help me through it and give me some advice. She's very caring
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: If you have the chance to take her class, do it. She's one of the best math professors at KSU. While Calc 2 can be tough, the extra credit she offers on exams makes it really hard to fail.

Professor C definitely knows the material, but I think she tends to forgot that students don't have a PHD in mathematics. She can get irritated easily, shames students for asking simple questions that she deems as stupid, and is very unapproachable. You have 4 tests which are worth 50% of your entire grade unlike most other classes where it's 20%.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. C makes calc 2 easy to understand. Her explanations of topics is thorough and she gives a lot of practice. Study guides are very similar to exams and theres usually extra credit opportunities on them. Homework can be difficult but there is unlimited attempts. Take her if you can!

She is an amazing professor. Shows that she cares about the success of her students, knows your name even if you are in the back of class quiet, and dumbs down concepts pretty well. She can be tough on students but pushes them to be better. Homework is usually harder than the tests though and Achieve is not the best.
Shes such a good prof and makes all the concepts so easy to understand. If you take her and make sure to do the homework this class will be an easy A

A lot of tests. Homework is infinite attempts but is difficult. 
First half was incredibly hard 2nd half of the class with series got really easy just be prepared to defend why the series converges or diverges and there are no "holes" in it.
She is a great professor

Super caring. She provides multiple questions on the tests and says to complete 2 parts of out 3 of a question, so you can avoid topics that you do not love. Her tests are easier than her in class work. I finished Calc 2 with a 100 because of her. She does a wonderful job explaining things, just make sure you know your prereqs.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Every exam came with a good amount of bonus points. Really enjoyed going to class. Spends the whole class before a test to review specific topics. She's really helpful in general.

Makes Calc 2 easy to understand. Go to her office hours, ask questions. Practice outside class and redo study guides before exams and you'll get an A since 85+ is an A. The final combines all previous exams. She's not for everyone, but if you can handle some sorority attitude and avoid stupid questions, she'll love you.

Gives study guides with no answer key. Provides no notes outside of class. Pop quizzes when she is mad at her students. Definitely treats her students like they are in high school still. Good teacher, but she has an odd way of doing things.

Not for everyone. Taken in Summer. Good lectures that sometimes went too long on basic concepts instead of tougher ones. Meh grading (rare extra credit), harsh policies (no test dropping for any reason but documented medical, no score replacement). Weekly quizzes - similar policies. Grade only from quizzes and tests, not HW or attendance. HW sucked

This is one of the best professors I have ever had. She truly cares a lot. If you are confused at all at something, simply attend her office hours and she will explain it as many times as you need. If you try and ask for help its hard not to be successful. She gives a study guide for each test and it is very similar to the test. TAKE HER!

Great Professor. I have taken Calc 1 a few times, and this instructor was far superior to the ones I had previously taken. Provides clear study guides for tests. The final was material to be expected and not surprising at all. Overall, the communication with this course was very clear from start to finish.

Dr. C is an amazing calculus professor, i took her for calc I and II. She's a knowledgeable and engaging Her exams are structured to allow you to pick and choose problems based on your strengths. She has extra credit embedded in all her exams, including final. There is HW every week, but you have infinite attempts on it.

I'm a big fan of Dr. Christensen as a lecturer. She includes extra credit points in every exam. The prerequisite exam - letting us know what we needed to review in order to be successful in the class - was the hardest exam for myself and most of my peers. Dr. C is very personable and explains things in a way that is very easy to digest.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr Christensen is great. Took her this last spring semester for calc 2 and learned a ton. If you want to learn calc 2 and still get a good grade I would take here. It is not easy but sooooo possible to do well.
Honestly a great teacher. She could probably teach this stuff to a room of 4th graders if she wanted to. Her tests are also pretty easy with a ton of eand the homework contains the most difficult

I would never had taken her if I knew what she was like. she was a tough grader and expect us to know everything like we done this before. There is also no calculators allowed on test, only the basic ones that can barely divide anything. she gives a lot of homework with 3 sections a week and EACH section is around 20-30 problems, all due in a week.
She is very nice but is too smart to dumb it down. She expects you to already be familiar with the content. If you ask a question she will most likely give you a condescending answer.

Overall she's an okay professor just super boring lectures and lots of homework each week. Attendance is randomly a grade, and on tests she is very picky about your work and will take off partial points. She is easy to get time with alone and/or quick to respond to emails. She is also pretty good about bumping/rounding grades.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I had Professor Christensen for Calc I during the Summer 2023 semester. Compared to my previous Calc I professor, it was night and day. She teaches in a way that's very accessible and understandable and is very capable of explaining things differently if you don't get it the first time. Very rare quizzes. Bonus points available on every test.

Dr. C is a great Professor, her lectures are very clear, informative, and engaging. She's very helpful and explains all material very clearly. The HW she gives is a bit difficult, but it prepares you for exams, along with her amazing study guides/reviews. The exams are easy! Definitely recommend her for Calc l. Put in effort and you'll do great!

She puts in a lot of effort to teach in the most efficient way - and always asks us for advice on how she can improve. Her lectures were well organized and easy to follow. Tests were fairly short and she gives partial credit for wrong answers. Attendance quiz after every test, random pop quizzes, extra credit provided on tests and surveys.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: A genuinely great option for Calculus 1. She knows her stuff, but doesn't speak in a manner that is incomprehensible, instead being very easy to understand. As a professor, she is friendly and approachable. Highly recommend for STEM majors and "not math people" alike!

Dr. C was overall great in teaching the course. I am often intimidated to take a math course, but she made it fairly ok for someone who hasn't taken a math course in three years. She has four tests throughout the semester and one final. Make sure you know your algebra and trig skills!! I learned a lot from her!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor. Lectures are good, explains everything over and over again to make sure you understand. Will answer any questions you have, and does a lot for extra credit and bonus points. Usually 3 homework's due on the weekend, but its not that much.

Overall a very good prof. 4 tests, 1 cumulative final. She's willing to answer your questions and very accessible out of class. Somewhat homework heavy but not too bad. Make sure to take time and study the content and attend Open Math Lab to get any extra help. Attendance counts as a quiz grade plus she's really sweet so go to class! Do her review
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: 10/10 she is truly amazing. What she says is more important than what she writes down, so you must listen closely to what she is saying. Calculus is a tough subject especially if you aren't confident in your pre-requisite skills. She is the best option. The Final Exam was hard and the class didn't feel prepared. You will dedicate your life to Calc.

This class requires pure dedication.  Prof. Christensen gave very little chances to improve grades like extra credit. The extra credit she does give out is no more than a few points (1-5). Has few questions on the test meaning they are worth a lot. She does partial credit but it is not a saving grace. Her study guides are not a 1:1 for the exam.

Overall okay professor, shes really understanding but a lot of the time the class felt like it cared more about calc 1&2 concepts over calc 3 concepts, I forgot a double angle identity and lost 40% of the question, despite setting up the rest of the problem correctly. Definitely a more computational class than a theory class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Dr. Christensen is an instructor sent from heaven. She is extremely articulate, kind, respectful, and understanding. She's willing to restructure her schedule based on the needs of the class. She gives good feedback and clearly wants her students to succeed. She respects your pronouns, she's kind, and she's very honest. Please take her if possible!
She is a very intelligent and well versed professor. She made calculus easy to understand. If you want to actually learn calculus take her! Bonus offered as well as study guide material.

She is probably the best professor I have taken, who actually knows how to teach. She will go step by step with you to ensure you understand the subject. The exams all offer extra credit and she grades with partial credit. If you do the study guides for the exam you will pass the class.

If you want to actually learn, TAKE HER!!!! Exams are reasonable and she provides study guides. The material is really difficult but if you actually participate in class and do the homework, you WILL pass the course. There's a huge difference in the quality of her teaching skills compared to other KSU professors.

best math professor I had, 85 and above is an A, if you have a 93 average you will be exempt from the final. The study guide will be provided for each test. There will be a pre-requisite exam on the first week so make sure to review trig and calc 1 topics!

I took Dr. C for calc I and II and it is honestly rare to find a math professor as passionate and awesome as she is. If your goal is to truly understand calculus, please take this professor because she is amazing at teaching this topic!! I wish I could take her for all my other math courses.

One of the best math teachers I've had in my academic career. Thoroughly explained every aspect of the problems and gave very clear practice problems. HW was almost impossible to not get a 100 on. I wish she taught every high level math class at KSU. She is a phenomenal teacher and the 350 character limit won't do her justice. Take her at all costs

Very good professor. Went pretty fast (i took it over the summer) but would always slow down and explain in depth if anybody had a question. 4 tests all semester, and a final exam at the end. Overall, pretty fun and understanding person.

truly the best math professor ive had to date. dr c is fun in class, the course has no choice but to go quickly but she does a great job of making sure everyone is understanding and if they arent that she is able to meet with them outside of class. also just a super fun person to be around and one of the sweetest people

She is very caring and has very easy and clear lectures. She is willing to work with a student, always answers questions. There are 4 unit tests and a final(no need to take if ur grade is 95 or higher). Tests are around 10 questions, final was 16. LOTS OF BONUS ON TESTS. Mandatory attendence, 2 hour class. Tests=70min with review before. final=2h.

This class was is hard. Maybe b/c I'm taking it over the summer and is very fast paced. She can teach well and will gladly answer any questions, she always has a positive attitude. Course Engagement 15%(some pop quizes, fairly easy tho), Homework 15%, Four Exams(12.5% each)50%, Final 20% Didn't take calc 2 with her cause I could barley handle calc1
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: DO NOT take her!! She expects you to answer test questions EXACTLY the way she taught them and if you answer them a bit differently, she will accuse you of cheating even if you haven't cheated!! Be ready for smart remarks if you ask a question. Also, she has random outbursts of passive aggressiveness and blames it on not getting enough sleep.

Dr. C is both an amazing professor and an amazing person. She does an excellent job explaining topics and she genuinely cares about her students. If you put attend class and do your homework, you'll pass the class. That being said, just make sure you review your algebra and trig skills. This is a hard class, but Dr. C makes it a lot more relieving.

Dr. C is caring of her students, but she can be very personal when seeing that her students don't know the pre-req skills like trig and algebra. If you are taking her, make sure to know your trig! It will be on every exam and can cause you to lose easy points. This class is not easy so make sure to have time to study, reach out to her, if needed!

As long as you show up to class and do the homework, you should succeed. Lectures are posted online early and the SI was a lot of help too. The study guides have no answers but will have similar questions on the test. Just make sure to review previous concepts in Precalc and Algebra.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Cares abt students & happy to answer questions; available outside class. Posts lecture slides early. Pre-req exam and ppts to help students review. Extra credit opportunities on and off tests and grade scale adjusted. MyMathLab HW with unlimited attempts. Study guides lack answer keys but are very accurate to tests. Had a great relationship with SI

Dr. C is one of the best math instructors I've had. She is very caring of her students and really helps the students understand the material. Her grading criteria for test is clear. You'll have to put effort in this class since Calc 1 is a hard subject but the extra credit opportunities and bonus questions on test does help out a lot.

I made sure to let her know this as well, but Dr. C is/was byfar the best math professor I have ever taken in my entire school career. She cares deeply for her students and is willing to put in the extra work to match whatever effort you put into the work she gives you. She makes it very clear what her expectations are for her class. Take Dr.C!!

85% and above is an A. Allows exemption from final with a good enough grade and attitude. Great with questions. She does not hand out freebies and its a hard topic for some but I would retake her in an instant.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I really liked Dr. C. She's a good lecturer, and her expectations were quite reasonable. Online homework was short but helpful. She gave quizzes to provide feedback and prepare students for tests. Tests were fair; we got to choose the questions we wanted graded and skip a few in case we weren't as comfortable with a topic.

She is the best CALC 2 professor at the university. If you put effort into learning, you will easily pass this class regardless of your current mathematic skills. She's great at answering questions, grades very generously, and above all, she wants to see her students succeed. If you can't pass with her as your professor, then change your major lol

She was the BEST math teacher ever asked for. She makes sure you understand the topic that she's teaching. She has extra credits, and gives good feedback after the tests. The tests also contain bonus questions that will boost your grade. if you pay attention in her class, easy A. She is very hardworking teacher and cares about her students grade.
She previously started teaching Calculus 2 and acts very sarcastic and narcissistic. If you ask a question you might receive a smart remark.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Taking Calculus 1 with Dr. Christensen was a pretty good decision. Although I'd taken AP Calc in high school, Dr. Christensen was so much better at explaining the stuff in a more understandable way that made the calculus seem super easy. Also, she gives tons of extra credit opportunities on tests. 10/10 would take again.
Guys DO NOT take her. She literally gives student integrity even you have not cheated. Yes, shes a good professor but she wants answers the way she taught in class.
She was a great professor, but very strict so just know you have to actually put in work. She has really good lectures and the study guides are just like the test.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Christensen is super sweet and explains everything very thoroughly. If you have any questions, she wouldnt hesitate to help you understand. If youre struggling, take advantage of her SI sessions and office hours. She gives a lot of extra credit and adds it at the end of the semester which boosts your grade. Youll love her.

My absolute favorite math teacher. She's so supportive of you and your success. She makes calculus very easy and manageable. She gives a ton of extra creditI was able to end the class with a 100 (originally a 95). She's very straightforward about what's going to be covered and tested, and always makes sure that we're mentally doing good.

Dr.C was not too bad. I think she is a solid choice for math class. She goes over plenty of examples and reviews the day before the test with more. Ask questions if you not sure about something, She will be glad to help, very kind person. Homework is on MML and test are long at times but she gives extra credit. Can over explain at times.

Dr. C was a great teacher, made online learning easy. Used a combination of publisher videos to introduce concepts to watch outside of class and then goes over again in class and does lots of examples. Grading and tests are very fair with option for bonus on tests. Would definitely take again.

Material is expected to be learned before lectures through the videos she posts, lectures glaze over concepts and are for questions; tests are long and as a slow test taker, managing time was a bit difficult; homework and participation questions taken weekly(time consuming class); very accesible and easy to communicate with, wants student success
